news.title: Kolhapur: 60,000 land group numbers from 1,200 villages declared 'deemed NA'
news.para: Kolhapur district administration has launched a major initiative declaring 60,000 group numbers non-agricultural. This move will directly benefit three lakh citizens across 1,200 villages. The decision simplifies the process for landholders to obtain non-agricultural status. Requirements for multiple No Objection Certificates have been removed. This aims to ease development and save citizens time and money.

news.title: Pune civic body to frame guidelines for PGs as residents flag issues
news.para: Pune Municipal Corporation will survey abhyasikas and paying guest accommodations in old city areas to address overcrowding, safety, and hygiene concerns. Guidelines will be issued for minimum space per student, sanitation, and safety, with potential commercial tax enforcement for PGs. The move aims to ensure basic student needs are met, though some express skepticism about enforcement.

news.title: Karnataka RERA plans single-window clearance system for real estate projects
news.para: Karnataka RERA is planning a single-window clearance system to streamline approvals for real estate projects, taking responsibility for liaising with government agencies. The authority aims for deemed approvals if agencies miss deadlines and is seeking powers to de-register sale agreements. The Mysuru real estate sector has stabilized after resolving e-khata issues.

news.title: ED to chargesheet Gurugram realty company, promoter for multi-crore 'fraud' in PMAY
news.para: The Enforcement Directorate is preparing to file charges against a Gurugram real estate firm and its leaders. The investigation involves alleged money laundering and fraud concerning the Pradhan Mantri Awas Yojna. Homebuyers' funds were reportedly diverted through inflated prices and cash premiums.

news.title: About 52% of housing societies in Pune lack legal land ownership
news.para: Over half of Pune's housing societies lack legal land ownership, hindering redevelopment and property rights.  Despite a legal mandate for developers to transfer land titles, bureaucratic hurdles and incomplete documentation cause significant delays.  Authorities are now pushing to expedite the process through nodal officers and area-wise camps.

news.title: No home can be demolished without due process: Allahabad HC
news.para: The Allahabad High Court has stayed the demolition of 27 houses in Bareilly's Shahabad area, directing civic authorities to refrain from coercive action until a final order is passed. Residents, who had received notices declaring their homes illegal, argued that the Municipal Corporation had collected taxes for years.

news.title: NGT halts construction at Pune project after MPCB flags violations of noise and dust norms
news.para: The National Green Tribunal has halted construction at a Pune residential project due to multiple pollution violations. The Maharashtra Pollution Control Board reported issues with dust, noise, and waste management. The tribunal ordered a stop to work until the developer implements necessary pollution control measures.

news.title: Bengaluru: Court freezes site after activist exposes builder’s alleged forged land document
news.para: A special court has demanded a full official report after claims that a leading builder used counterfeit papers to occupy public land, while police face pressure to register an FIR over alleged government inaction

news.title: About 10 hotels, resorts near Alwar’s Siliserh Lake sealed
news.para: Alwar Urban Improvement Trust (UIT) sealed 10 hotels and resorts operating without permission and land conversion in the Siliserh Lake area. Bulldozers demolished encroachments as the anti-encroachment squad, accompanied by police, took action against illegal constructions after issuing notices. Criminal cases will be filed if seals are removed.

news.title: Greater Bengaluru authority to hire urban designers & planners for city development
news.para: Bengaluru's Greater Bengaluru Authority (GBA) is establishing specialised Urban Design Cells, formally appointing urban designers and planners for the first time. This move aims to address long-standing civic issues by embedding design expertise into infrastructure development, focusing on streetscapes, public spaces, and mobility networks. The GBA is also preparing to white-top 488km of roads between 2025 and 2028.

news.title: Lucknow development body clears seven housing projects, 1,100 EWS homes
news.para: Lucknow Development Authority approved land acquisition for seven residential projects near Gomtinagar Extension, totaling 385 acres. The board also decided to keep LDA-built flat prices unchanged for a year and introduced graded discounts for gallantry awardees. Over 1,100 EWS houses were approved in Shardanagar, and shopkeepers from Sahara Market will be relocated.

news.title: Ghaziabad: Harnandipuram launch in five months, 336 hectares to be developed in phase-I
news.para: Ghaziabad Development Authority has begun a satellite survey for its Harnandipuram township, with the first phase slated to commence in five months. This initial phase will cover 336 hectares, primarily acquired from three villages. GDA is utilizing its website to facilitate land acquisition and address farmer concerns.

news.title: Critics claim new land registry rule favours big builders in Rajasthan
news.para: A new land registry rule in Jaipur mandating land conversion certificates for sale deeds has sparked widespread criticism. Critics argue the regulation unfairly benefits large builders, making it difficult for small landowners and farmers to register property. The rule also reportedly contradicts a Supreme Court ruling on registration procedures.

news.title: Maharashtra government grants legal status to digital land records
news.para: Maharashtra has officially granted legal status to digitally signed land records, including 7/12 and 8-A extracts. This landmark move eliminates the need for manual stamps and signatures, allowing citizens to obtain certified copies online for a nominal fee. The reform promises to end red tape, reduce corruption, and expedite land-related transactions for farmers and landowners across the state.

news.title: Delhi civic body proposes no hike in property tax rates for FY27
news.para: The Municipal Corporation of Delhi presented a Rs 16,531-crore budget for 2026-27, maintaining no property tax increases for the third consecutive year. The budget highlights a significant rise in taxpayer base and tax collection, with plans for administrative reforms and revenue enhancement through various initiatives.

news.title: Himachal Pradesh assembly refers land reforms bill to select committee
news.para: The Himachal Pradesh Assembly has referred the Tenancy and Land Reforms (Amendment) Bill, 2025 to a Select Committee for further examination. This committee is tasked with analyzing the bill and will deliver its recommendations at the upcoming Budget Session.

news.title: Nexus Select Trust evaluating three mall acquisitions in eastern India
news.para: Nexus Select Trust is exploring the acquisition of three malls in eastern India. The REIT is dedicating upwards of Rs 10 crore to transform South City Mall, with an emphasis on modernizing infrastructure and leveraging the latest technology.

news.title: Hyderabad: HMDA rakes in ₹3,862 crore as Neopolis-Golden Mile auctions hit new highs
news.para: Hyderabad's land market continues its strong performance, with HMDA auctions in Neopolis and Golden Mile layouts fetching ₹3,862 crore. The latest phase saw a 1.98-acre plot in Golden Mile sold for ₹77.75 crore per acre, reinforcing investor confidence in the city's growth. This sustained demand highlights Hyderabad's appeal as a prime real estate investment hub.

news.title: Frontier Warehousing acquires controlling stake in Kesoram Industries, Birla family exits
news.para: Kesoram Industries is undergoing a significant shift in leadership as Frontier Warehousing Limited steps in to acquire a controlling interest. This pivotal move signals the end of the Birla family's long-standing involvement with the company.

news.title: Sanjali Bajaj buys sea-view apartment in Mumbai’s Worli for ₹66 crore
news.para: Sanjali Bajaj, daughter of Bajaj Group’s Sanjiv Bajaj, has bought a ₹66.41-crore sea-view luxury apartment in Mumbai’s Worli. The 5,510 sq ft home includes a 430 sq ft balcony and additional podium-level spaces for parking. She paid ₹3.32 crore in stamp duty for the November 14 deal.
